website_summaries.verdict: This pasta is high in protein and fiber and low in carbs.
pros: Good for folks watching their carbs as well as people needing a gluten-free option
Tastes a lot like regular pasta
cons: It also includes tapioca, pea protein, and xanthan gum

customer_reviews.title: Bugs are horrifying
customer_reviews.text: I order this six pack of Banza at least once a month and have never had a problem. Today, as I emptied out the first box, I noticed a bag crawling in the bottom. I then looked in the pot and realized they were everywhere. This did not come from my house. The main box was sealed and bug free - they were in the individual boxes. I will never trust ordering banza online again, which is unfortunate as I love this product. This is absolutely disgusting and I would like a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gough

customer_reviews.title: Not an acceptable substitute.
customer_reviews.text: To me, this is nothing like real pasta: wrong taste (really, really wrong) and wrong texture. I love chickpeas, falafel and hummus, so I thought this would be a good choice for getting more protein into our vegetarian diet. Nope. Can't eat it. A lot of people like it but let me suggest getting one box to try before stocking your pantry.
customer_reviews.author: BeeJaae

customer_reviews.title: Bugs in box!
customer_reviews.text: I went to make this pasta tonight and opened the box to find a ton of tiny bugs crawling around in it! I thought it may just be that box so I opened another one and found the same thing! These boxes are both nowhere near their expiration date! I saw that someone else had experienced this as well. I would really like to receive my money back for this. These are not cheap!
customer_reviews.author: James Pruet

customer_reviews.title: banza pasta
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a lower carb option to traditional pasta, this works. Has higher protein content... and a lower carb count compared to regular pasta. The texture is something like "al dente" ... they taste almost exactly like pasta... slightly.. vegetabley?? I couldn't really pick out a "chick pea" flavor - everyone is different though... It's hard to describe.. but definitely tasty. I like that this was a "variety" case so you get to try different shapes... depending on what you using it for... sauce, casserole, etc... Honestly, I would buy it again. I also think if you haven't tried it, its worth trying.
customer_reviews.author: ForeverYOUNGTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Not what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: This pasta used to be made from just chickpea flour but since the company has changed its formula by adding tapioca flour and xanthium gum. I find the texture to be gummy and sticky now. I will not be buying this anymore. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I guess, don't expect  it to taste like a regular pasta ...
customer_reviews.text: I believed with all the buzz maybe I expected too much. It was hard to tell whether was cooked, so I cooked a little bit more which made the pasta very mushy, it looked almost like a "weird paste" after awhile. I have to agree with someone that said it tastes like a wet cardboard. " I'll try again since I bought too many boxes... I'll let you know
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for Pasta!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a lot of the alternatives to pasta and this by far the best! I love the different varieties there are - it really does replace regular pasta for me. Unlike some of the other pasta alternatives I've tried, Banza holds up well in the fridge in case you make more than you meant to or are trying to keep it for leftovers. I'm not gluten-free like some of the other reviewers, but I wanted to try it because it has the half the carbs and double the protein which is amazing. I don't think I'll go back to regular pasta after this...it's amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reviews were so positive
customer_reviews.text: Yuck - i can't give it away (really) - first I tried passing it off to my son and his wife and they had the same reaction . It just stays sitting on the way down. I tried. Maybe it's my digestive system as I'm a senior - but I couldn't cope with the heaviness of it. I bought the variety box so tried a number of different possibilities. Nothing like good old fashioned fattening pasta
customer_reviews.author: Diane Marino

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love
customer_reviews.text: I love Banza Chickpea pasta. I have so many recipes for low-calorie, healthy pasta meals. I cook up a box per week and have estimated that the Banza is only 24 carbs per serving. That's great for when I am on a low-carb, high protein diet. The pasta tastes great and I don't taste much difference between this and regular pasta. I like getting the assortment of pasta shapes in one shipment. Target and Walmart also sell it but in limited varieties.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C8

customer_reviews.title: My favorite fake pasta!
customer_reviews.text: So, I seem to have some dumb wheat allergy. This pasta makes it less tragic. I've tried a bunch of other fake pastas, then I found this chickpea delight, and it's 80% as good as real pasta. Slather a bunch of sauce on it, and you forget it's fake. My significant other (who does not have the bodily betrayal of an unfair wheat allergy) actually likes this pasta more than regular, because if its nutty flavor. So, it's the only pasta we keep on hand. Thanks, fake pasta manufacturers! Now get back in the lab and make some wheatless bagels!
customer_reviews.author: Claire Walker

customer_reviews.title: It's the bomb!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't feeling good about eating empty carbs (white bread, noodles etc) and found these at Costco initially. Wow! Not only are they full of fiber and protein, but they look and act like traditional pasta. I tried the Red Lentil noodles from Trader Joe's, but they were a bit like cardboard (especially when re-heating as leftovers), but these guys are pliable and soft. I love when food is tasty and nutritious! They are best priced when Costco has them in stock and I have found them at Target for $2.99 a box, but if either of those two places are not an option for you, Amazon is a good runner up.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney B.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this pasta! I am NOT gluten-free, vegan, low carb, or any of that. I count macros and this pasta is a great alternative to get in that protein and fiber without the added carbs. It cooks just like regular pasta! Although, I'd recommend not over cooking it, because if you do, the noodles just fall apart. Advice - stick with the shaped varieties. I tried the spaghetti and linguine version before without much success. The shells, rigatoni, penne, etc have all worked great! I use this pasta just as I would any pasta - brown some ground meat and mix in pasta sauce for an easy meal, or bake in casseroles in the oven.
customer_reviews.author: SadieTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: Banza pasta is really delicious and I feel so much better after eating it than after eating other types of pasta. This pasta absorbs different sauces really well and there is a lot you can do with it. I buy this frequently and would absolutely recommend it to anyone looking to avoid gluten or just increase the amount of fiber and/or protein in their diets. It may be a little bit more expensive than wheat-based pasta but I think it's more than worth it because I don't feel sluggish and tired after eating this.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Great Low Carb Pasta Substitute
customer_reviews.text: In the world of high protein, gluten free pasta options, this is the best tasting and most reasonably priced option I have tried. It isn't as good as the "pasta" deal but what could be?? The texture of Banza protein pasta is similar to real pasta. It does make a ton of foam when cooking that you have to rinse off before you put sauce on it . Sometimes the pasta will split during cooking or this process. However, the negatives are minimal when you compare it to other low carb pasta substitutes. If you have to eat a lower carb diet and you miss pasta like I did, try it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good substitute, but reduce the cooking time!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried a bunch of different “fake” pastas - rice, lentil, and so on. Banza is the only one that tastes like regular pasta and has the consistency of regular pasta. But you definitely should boil it for a significantly shorter time than the box says - the first couple of times I followed the directions and ended up with a gluey mess. Now I only cook it 5-6 minutes to get that just right “al dente” consistency, which is several minutes less than the directions. P.S. I did see that the ingredients recently changed from just chickpeas to chickpeas, tapioca, xanthan gum, etc. But I didn’t notice a change in flavor or consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Sashy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t give up pasta!
customer_reviews.text: After starting on my health journey in Sept 2018 I cut out pasta and found myself craving and eating it on cheat days or over indulging days. But since I’ve found Banza-no more an issue! This prodcut is trying amazing-taste and texture are just as good, if not better than any pasta. Thank your for creating such a quality product that still lets me enjoy some comfort food-within reason!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: So expensive
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many various pasta blends in search of a healthier alternative. Saw this on Drew and Since I have been having a total dental rehab, there is very little I can chew and I needed to consider high protein foods. This fit the bill both protein and fiber. No it doesn’t taste or have the same texture as regular pasta but it is pretty good. My issue is the cost. It is very expensive which is how Drew Barrymore can afford it! Also the variety box is all short cut pasta and sometimes you need a bowl of spaghetti! I will most likely not order again because the cost does not deliver.?
customer_reviews.author: R. Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!! REALLY like this stuff! Had a serving of leftover spaghetti sauce in the fridge, and served it with about 1/4 box of penne. Delicious! The pasta tastes very faintly like chickpeas. And is much more tender and less cardboard than whole wheat pasta, and has none of the gumminess of the regular semolina pasta. Looking forward to more experiments. Please, can you make lasagna noodles?! P.S.: My order page said the shipment was handed to a resident. Not true. It was left on my porch.
customer_reviews.author: bunnysaver

customer_reviews.title: WE LOVE THIS PASTA
customer_reviews.text: You cannot tell that these are made of garbanzo when you eat them. We’ve paired these with so many red sauces, pestos, cheese sauces, etc, and each tastes delicious. If you can’t have normal pasta, this is a godsend. We stopped eating most carbs for a diet and missed pasta so much - finding this was the best day in months. We’ll eventually stop the diet, but we’ll be eating Banza pasta long past the diet ends. This is such a great product.
customer_reviews.author: hnix

customer_reviews.title: BEST GLUTEN FREE EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This product is the best gluten-free I have ever bought.,,,I even reheated it the next day and it was not mushy and had wonderful flavor. Not grainy. I simply followed the directions, it was just as easy as wheat pasta. I promise you will not regret your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting, healthy, filling pasta
customer_reviews.text: So glad I tried this product. I'm someone that's very health conscious and trying to put on muscle in the gym. For a while, my go-to pasta for carb loading has been Barilla Protein Plus. Having now tried Banza, it not only tastes better, but it has Way more protein, fiber and nutrients I care about that support my fitness goals and health. Usually premium products in any category are quite costly, but this is very reasonably priced which is an added bonus. Try it, you will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Can't tell difference
customer_reviews.text: Took a pasta salad made with Banza Pasta to a potluck. Later someone asked me why I was eating "regular" pasta since I am wheat-free. I told them it was made with chickpea and they were surprised as it tasted just like wheat pasta to them. I couldn't say that for sure as I have been wheat-free for years. All I know is it tastes great and works for pasta salad as well as pasta with sauce.
customer_reviews.author: Jane M.

customer_reviews.title: Probably good just not my taste
customer_reviews.text: Your product is probably good and good for you but personally Ii didn't like the taste. I donated to the food bank. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona gal

customer_reviews.title: Bitter Mush
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand all the positive reviews. Due to my son's allergy to flour, we were on the search to an alternative pasta. The fact that we like chickpeas coupled with great recommendations for this pasta on Amazon, we decided to give this pasta a try. Like another reviewer mentioned, the pasta turns to mush! ... and i didn't even mention the overwhelming bitter flavor. I have been known to stomach less than appetizing food, but even I couldn't handle the flavor or texture. There is no way my children will ever eat this.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: It’s close, but no cigar.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these. The consistency is close but not quite there. If you had to eat a pasta that wasn’t pasta, this would have to work. It’s very close just not the right consistency. They don’t hold their shape when tossed with meat sauce. Ordered the 6 pack and sadly the 5 will sit in the pantry for a long time. **EDIT** Leftovers are even worse when reheated in the microwave.
customer_reviews.author: 907Fire

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended At All
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. I'm not a pasta purist, but I find Banza noodles unpleasant in flavor, texture, bite, appearance, and aftertaste. The product cooks quickly but then requires rinsing and reheating, so it is not even especially convenient. For me this is a waste of good chickpeas and certainly no substitute for whole wheat or brown rice pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Jack11615

customer_reviews.title: Yumm!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful gluten free pasta, and I really like the fact that it is a high protein food. It has a reasonable flavor by itself and is a great pasta with tomato sauce or pesto on it. I would recommend using a bigger than normal pot, as this pasta foams a lot (as does all other chickpea pasta that I have tried).
customer_reviews.author: RabiysRhyme

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good.
customer_reviews.text: Read about this chickpea pasta somewhere. It’s expensive, but I’m trying to add protein to my new vegan diet, and this helps. It actually tastes decent and has a pretty good texture. I didn’t try the long, thin shape, as the review I read in a foodie source said that shape didn’t hold up well. I like it for a “pasta substitute.”
customer_reviews.author: madbaker

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: This was cheaper per box on amazon than target or my local grocery, heb. I think this tastes better than “real” pasta. I do a VERY low bread, rice, potato, pasta diet but not full keto and I use this as a “cheat” every few weeks, great w/ butter, olive oil, garlic, basil, oregano, and a little mozzarella cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Impressive substitute for traditional pasta
customer_reviews.text: This pasta is awesome! I didn't think delicious low carb + high fiber pasta existed until I tried this. We just made a version of mac & cheese with the shells, and my picky boyfriend and his kid couldn't tell the difference. I don't know how well it reheats or works for pasta salad, but for normal hot pasta dishes, I can't recommend it enough if you're looking for a healthier pasta option.
customer_reviews.author: Kahlia Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable good
customer_reviews.text: I had stopped eating pasta. I'm not glucose intolerant or anything, it just wasn't nutritious. But this!!! I see it and no one knows it isn't regular pasta. I can't believe how good it is. Hardier than regular pasta and you definitely don't want to over cook it. It falls apart. But once you have mastered the amount of timing it's great. I'm eating pasta again!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbhe

customer_reviews.title: Great pasta, but poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: Great consistency for gluten free pasta and loaded with lots of fiber and protein too. However, I am a bit frustrated with the recent packaging as of late using half a roll of packaging tape to secure six boxes together, which is a mess to get undone without tearing boxes. It's definitely cheaper to buy online vs. my local stores.
customer_reviews.author: GMD

customer_reviews.title: Fulfills my carb craving
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I'm a type 2 diabetic and I cannot eat pasta as nearly as much as I want. As a matter of fact, I shouldn't be eating it at all (in case my doc is reading this). However, with Banza, I am able to fill my past cravings. I am not a big chickpea fan, but this is some good stuff. Only thing is, I boil the noodles about 1-2 minutes less than the recommended cooking time (just to keep the past from being too soggy). Now my carb cravings are filled without the blood sugar spike.
customer_reviews.author: Lamar P

customer_reviews.title: This Pasta is AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: Tastes just like the real thing, 90% of the time. We mixed the pasta with butternut squash and a pumpkin sauce and it tasted exactly like paste. Another time we made it with an alfredo sauce then added broccoli and asparagus, again exactly like the delicious real thing. However, once we just made it just marinara sauce, once it got cold you could tell it was made from chickpea. So as long as we add something extra to the dish and eat it before it cools off, it's excellent. Overall, I am blown away with how tasty and healthy Banza is. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Stickle

customer_reviews.title: very good.
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised with this product. I hate chickpeas on their own. But this pasta is good. You would never know it is made from chickpeas. It actually has very little flavor. And that's ok. There is a lot of foam while cooking and it says on the box that there will be some foam. Texture is not as smooth as regular pasta. Still... not bad. As for diabetics; there is 43 net carbs for 3.5 ounces.
customer_reviews.author: SFV

customer_reviews.title: Great pasta chick pea option for Gluten Free people
customer_reviews.text: I have been Gluten Free for around the last 18 months for health reasons and had not found a suitable/tasteful pasta option. Saw these initially at Costco and a neighbor recommended them and tried them out. These are the BEST alternate to regular pasta I have found!!! Unfortunately as they seem to do, Costco discontinued them but they seem to be available in the local Safeway/Giant.
customer_reviews.author: MCM

customer_reviews.title: Great Pasta Alternative
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a great pasta alternative that does not have a weird texture when cooked. Banza doesn't have a strong chickpea taste and retains it's shape after cooking. Like all pasta alternatives, it doesn't taste exactly like wheat pasta, but it's the best substitute I've found so far. My husband is usually very picky about all dairy/pasta/meat substitutes, and will devour this pasta without any complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: The only noodles we use!
customer_reviews.text: We love Banza noodles and they're the only noodles we use in our house now! They are the only GF noodle I have tasted that doesn't have a weird texture or take forever to cook. Plus we love all the added benefits of the chickpeas. Attached is a pic of a yummy pumpkin mac and cheese I made for dinner last night!
customer_reviews.author: Bree Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: This pasta is wonderful! I am a huge texture eater and when I want pasta I want pasta. Not zoodles or some imitation to get you buy. I also have been working on upping my protein consumption and this definitely helps. I like the fact that these are half the carbs and double the protein of traditional pasta while also having a very close taste and texture to regular pasta. I'm hooked!
customer_reviews.author: EJohns23

customer_reviews.title: *** LOVE THIS PASTA****
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are both gluten intolerant, and we have tried many gluten free pastas, this is our favorite! We officially found it at Costco, but they quit carrying it. All gluten free pasta are expensive, but this pasta tastes like pasta, and does not fall apart, when you cook it, so I feel it is worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Great find for my particular situation
customer_reviews.text: Product was recommended by my nutrional councelor based on my many food sensitivities. I was pleasantly surprised at the ease of use, I cooked it just short of the recommended cook time and added it to my beef stroganoff so it could finish cooking using the beef juices. Turned out perfectly. My husband even commented on the flavor and texture . Thank you for this product to help me accomplish my goal.
customer_reviews.author: Jane S

customer_reviews.title: Great pasta alternative
customer_reviews.text: Banza is a wonderful alternative to regular pasta if you're looking for something with a little bit better macros but can't seem to shake that need to eat pasta. Substitutes well for any pasta dish you might make with normal pasta. Texture is a bit grainier feeling than eating regular pasta, and it's definitely noticeable when cooking as you can see it breaking down a bit, but not enough of a difference to be a huge turn off. Flavor is a bit different as well, but again not enough to matter unless you're eating it on it's own with no sauce. As a healthier (well, relative to normal pasta) I'd highly recommend this as a go to substitute
customer_reviews.author: LsSEA

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: Delicious pasta. Great option for vegetarians trying to add more protein to their diets. Very convenient to order from Amazon because lately it is always sold out at my local supermarket. I took off one star because a couple of the boxes arrived crushed up and the pasta inside had gone all crumbly (but still edible). Make sure you stir well and frequently while cooking as some types tend to stick together/to the pot. Ignore the foam that comes from boiling—it’s totally normal.
customer_reviews.author: Max Basch

customer_reviews.title: Great for Vegan Recipes
customer_reviews.text: I made a Vegan Mac n' Cheese dish with this pasta for the first time. It was delicious. I love how the pasta does not take long to make at all. The pasta held together great. It wasn't mushy or breaking apart. This brand is going to be a staple in my house. Whenever I make a Pasta dish, I'll be using Banza. The flavor is light and taste so good. Thank you so much for a delicious product. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Chocolategirl516

customer_reviews.title: Family Favorite
customer_reviews.text: We love this pasta! It has a thicker texture than regular pasta, but if I had not known any better, I would never have guessed that it was made from chickpeas. Our whole family loves it, and eats it once a week. If you have never tried this pasta, I would highly recommend checking it out. It gives you a full feeling without feeling like you are going to burst. We love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda W.

customer_reviews.title: Great protein great taste
customer_reviews.text: We have switched to using this product for all of our pasta dishes. Makes great Macaroni & Cheese, wonderful with alfredo sauce or just a regular marinara. Love that there's so much protein in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zero taste.  Just kinda gross.
customer_reviews.text: Finally tried these. They are absolutely tasteless. Complete waste of money for me, as you can’t return food. I feel bad even trying to give them away. What a bummer! Should have stuck with my red lentil pasta.
customer_reviews.author: D B Consumer

customer_reviews.title: As good as any carb pasta that I've tasted...
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to prepare, and with any sauce or cheese, you can't tell that it's not regular pasta, although it has a slightly nuttier taste. We love it, and haven't cooked with any pasta since finding it. You can't go wrong...and it's healthier than pure carbs.
customer_reviews.author: Simone de Beauvoir

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I have made pasta twice now with the chick pea pasta. Hate them. It is not so much the taste, which I did not enjoy, but the texture was mushy even when I did not over cook. Just not for me by a better cook might have better luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy and fed Toddler = Happy Parents
customer_reviews.text: We're hot and heavy into the toddler phase and get exhausted trying to get wholesome and differing food to our little one. It's oatmeal, pasta, scrambled eggs or nothing. These have been rgeat egtting her to experiment and try other things!
customer_reviews.author: Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting!
customer_reviews.text: This is gummy, starchy and has a pretty bad aftertaste. We cooked this for way under the suggested time and still could not get a decent texture. If we could, we may be able to overlook the taste but this product is just one big FAIL!
customer_reviews.author: C. FONG

customer_reviews.title: Yucky...personal thought...I don’t like the taste
customer_reviews.text: I realize this is probably an outstanding product, but I can’t get past the taste. I don’t like this at all. The consistency...the flavor. Yuck!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Blackham

customer_reviews.title: Get your protein anywhere you can.
customer_reviews.text: Good product! I mix them with gluten-free pasta. The consistency is a little different and the mix helps. Some of the pasta comes crushed in little pieces, but again mixing it with another pasta makes a difference. It’s worth it if you’re looking to get protein any where you can.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to traditional pasta
customer_reviews.text: As a new vegetarian I'm doing everything I can to beef up (pun intended) the protein in my meals. This pasta tastes good, has the right texture and holds sauce well. It's a little expensive but considering how much nutritional value it has I still think it's an overall win. I'll definitely be eating Banza regularly!
customer_reviews.author: Vigilante

customer_reviews.title: Banza is THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: I have been eating Banza for years now, usually buying it from Whole Foods, so I am psyched that I can get it on Amazon now! I gave up pasta a few years ago but I still wanted something that was as easy to cook and had a similar texture, and I found that in Banza. It's also way healthier because it's made out of chickpeas so it has lots of protein in it! 10/10 would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just like pasta....only BETTER!
customer_reviews.text: This is incredible! Taste just like traditional pasta but so much better! High in protein, lower in carbs & calories. Both my husband & I love pasta so we were rather hesitant to try this. We thought it would taste like cardboard but fortunately it is the complete opposite. Very tasty but a little pricey. The price may be due to the newness of the product and hopefully it will come down later once more & more people by this wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Jan 00

customer_reviews.title: Love the taste
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time trying Banza after it being recommended by a friend. I was pleasantly surprised by the taste and love the protein count and lower net carb count. Will defiantly be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: matt hawksworth

customer_reviews.title: Nice gluten free pasta
customer_reviews.text: Such an amazing replacement for regular pasta! Tases good and keeps together without falling apart. I’m not celiac, just sensitive, so my stomach was very happy with it. Good variety of shapes of pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Iuliia Nozdriakova

customer_reviews.title: Banza tastes pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: 5.17.19 I tried the Banza shells yesterday. After cooking, then draining, I added grated cheese & it tasted good to me, reminded me of the real thing. I do think Banza is over priced but it tastes good. It will take awhile before I use up the six boxes; maybe the price will go down by then. 5.17.19 KayM in NC
customer_reviews.author: KayM

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try!
customer_reviews.text: I was hearing a lot about this pasta and finally decided to give it a try and it was pretty good! The taste is only slightly different but its easy to cook and is definitely a healthier alternative to regular pasta. I also love the fact that it has so much protein and keeps me fuller longer. Definitely try it if you haven't before!
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed with Banza!
customer_reviews.text: Since discovering Banza, I don’t think I’ve eaten regular pasta. This multipack is an incredible value given how filling this pasta is and therefore how little one eats in a sitting. I love all of the varieties and continue to be amazed by how tasty Banza is. Note- the rotini tends to fall apart when reheated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pasta
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this pasta. I really can't eat a lot of carbs and this product has lower carbs than traditional pastas. I noticed it cooks up a little quicker so you have to watch it so it will not get too soft. I like the flavor only noticed slight hint of chick pea. I don't mind chick peas but my husband does not and he thought the homemade mac and I cheese I made with these was great. So overall great product but by no means carb-free. This did not raise my carbs as quickly as regular pasta does most likely all the fiber in it.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian

customer_reviews.title: I am definitely ordering more to try with other recipes as it seems like this soaks up more sauce/moisture than regular dry pastas
customer_reviews.text: It has a very different consistency than regular Barilla or Golden Grain type dry pasta. It is a lot heartier, takes longer to cook...but is surely worth the wait! It is very filling/satisfying and sticks with you longer than regular dry. It doesn't cause the bloating that regular or wheat varieties cause. I am definitely ordering more to try with other recipes as it seems like this soaks up more sauce/moisture than regular dry pastas. I am excited for the variety in my diet and for that of my family; now with vegetarians! Overall=5*****!
customer_reviews.author: Alfred

customer_reviews.title: This pasta is amazing! Tastes just like flour pasta in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: This pasta is amazing! Tastes just like flour pasta in my opinion. The only downside is it creates a weird foam while boiling. Definitely cook in a pot ridiculously larger than needed because of the foam it will overflow rather quickly in a normal size pot.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa D

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and did not last
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 5 boxes less than 2 months ago. When I opened the 2nd box today and found it full of bugs. I opened the rest of the boxes. They all have bugs inside and have to be thrown away. It is very disappointing and I will never buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: tried the penne with a tomato pesto and it was very good. Any hint of flavor imparted by the chickpeas ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the variety pack which includes non-spaghetti pasta types such as penne, rotini, shells, etc. I have, so far, tried the penne with a tomato pesto and it was very good. Any hint of flavor imparted by the chickpeas was masked by the pesto. I don't know whether or not they produce spaghetti types of pasta but would be very interested in how their version of angel hair pasta would work with the necessarily lighter sauces preferred for them.
customer_reviews.author: Ean Behr

customer_reviews.title: Not a great pasta alternative
customer_reviews.text: This does not even remotely taste like pasta but to be honest, it is unrealistic to expect it to. The macros are great. Awesome fiber content. But if you are finicky about texture, give this a pass. It's doughy and pasty and doesn't absorb the sauce well. However, I will buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: S Burns

customer_reviews.title: You can't tell it's not "regular" pasta
customer_reviews.text: I eat a lot of pasta as it makes sense for work week. Lots of dishes that can be made for entire week! So wanted to try healthier pasta. This sure fits the bill! Good consistency also. Tastes good! You can't really tell it's not "regular" pasta. And great deal, with the different types of pasta. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: VT2012

customer_reviews.title: A smart healthy pasta
customer_reviews.text: It’s really Not bad at all but it’s not like regular pasta it has its own taste. If you make a good sauce it’s pretty good. I look at like I can’t eat gluten and I don’t want a lot of carbs so this adds a lot of protein to balance out the pasta.
customer_reviews.author: by Kathleen (Your signature)

customer_reviews.title: Best alternative pasta I've tried
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had anything better and I've tried a lot of them. Tastes very similar to the real stuff...and it even reheats the next day pretty well unlike the others I've tried. Along with Beyond Italian Sausage, it felt like I had a true pasta sauce last night despite it all being plant based. Great option for vegetarians
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Nye

customer_reviews.title: Weird texture
customer_reviews.text: Something about the texture/consistency of this chickpea pasta is a little unsatisfying but overall, with enough sauce, it's manageable. It's a great idea for a high protein pasta, can't wait to see if they improve the texture a bit in the future.
customer_reviews.author: cableknit

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I had just recently heard of this pasta, and was very excited to try it! I have been substituting normal pasta with quinoa pasta for a while, but was intrigued by the low carb/high protein content of the Banza pasta in comparison. I absolutely love this stuff! The texture is spot on to real pasta, and the taste is as well. I honestly would have a hard time differentiating if I had to do a blind taste test. The only complaint I can think of is that the pasta box is smaller compared to a conventional pasta, but the Taste, texture, variety, and price are all positive! Would definitely recommend and will continue to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amy w.

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: This cooks up just like real pasta! I find it to be very easy on the tummy (even with all of the fiber) and a great option for those with dietary restrictions who still want real pasta. Will definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Christina B.

customer_reviews.title: Cost is not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Great item, taste and cooked okay. But it’s SO EXPENSIVE per count! I’ve ended up shopping the local Groceries for gluten-free pasta instead because there’s no way I’m paying twice as much for half the quantity.
customer_reviews.author: Anagram17

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: Very similar to white pasta. Do not over cook (slightly more brittle so it will fall apart) and it tastes much better hot (not good in pasta salad in my opinion). Very filling and overall good white pasta alternative
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: a great substitution for the semolina-based product
customer_reviews.text: I've turned to a gluten- and sugar-free diet. As I enjoy the comfort of a bowl of 'noodles and gravy" finding Banza's product was a wonderful replacement! The cooking time for this pasta is abut 1-2 minutes longer but it's worth the wait.
customer_reviews.author: lp-TN-001

customer_reviews.title: This was really tasty
customer_reviews.text: This exceeded my expectations - nice flavor, nice texture. I would certainly purchase again. It is obviously more costly that regular pasta, but that is pretty much what you expect when you decide to increase the quality of the food that you eat.
customer_reviews.author: look4ward

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but really good
customer_reviews.text: Solid pasta, a great option for us. A bit pricey compared to others. *ordered again, decidedly worth the money for a product we can all enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Banza Lover
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Banza pasta and I’ve already eaten almost all of it! For anyone looking for pasta with less carbs, this is certainly the way to go! It’s filling and delicious... I can’t rave about it enough! It definitely tastes different from regular pasta if you eat it plain, but with sauce, it’s almost impossible to tell. I love the texture, shape options, and the fact that I feel healthier when eating it compared to regular pasta. If you are still deciding whether or not to give it a try, this is a no brainer — go for it! You’ll be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Meryl S

customer_reviews.title: As a pretty dedicated athlete I'm always looking for great tasting
customer_reviews.text: As a pretty dedicated athlete I'm always looking for great tasting, high protein foods that are quick to prepare. Banza's pasta really kills it in this department. It cooks to a very nice consistency - almost identical to regular pasta - and tastes great sauteed with kale or spinach, a meat of choice, and a spicy italian sauce. I don't have any allergies or intolerances but I do have friends that do and its nice to be able to share the same dish when we have them over! Keep up the good work Banza!
customer_reviews.author: PenguinClassics

customer_reviews.title: Taste ok. Protein and quality ingredients excellent!
customer_reviews.text: The taste is doable. But the added protein benefit makes it totally worth it. Tastes best with a cheese or cheese like sauce, IMO. Expensive on here. They are cheaper at my Safeway store.
customer_reviews.author: Airbornebaby229

customer_reviews.title: bug infested - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: we recently opened our boxes of chickpea noodles by banza. They where infested with bugs every box! The expiration date was not until nov. of 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Hein

customer_reviews.title: Best noodles!
customer_reviews.text: Great gf noodles! I love that there is no grain!!! Love the variety as well as price. My kids love this brand and especially there shells! This makes gluten free so easy!
customer_reviews.author: Marion

customer_reviews.text: Honestly I’m not the biggest fan of chickpeas or anything made with chickpeas like hummus but this Banza chickpea pasta was beyond good! An amazing alternative for pasta. I made it with Rao’s marinara sauce and it was soooooo delicious!!! I would recommend:)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Al dente perfection
customer_reviews.text: I’ll start by saying that I am in no way gluten-free or anti-wheat at all. And I’m super into pasta. I rarely buy pasta outside of an Italian grocery, so I’m pretty picky. But somehow I’ve found myself buying Banza, again and again. Every other vegetable-substitute pasta I’ve tried is mushy and foamy and does not do justice to the sauce. But the Banza texture is incredible, perfectly al dente, and even its pasta water does a great job bonding the pasta to its sauce. Plus I feel healthy eating it, so pasta night is no longer a cheat meal!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Edible, but Can't Stand the Smell
customer_reviews.text: I bought the six-pack thinking I would be able to get past any funky taste or texture, because I am already used to whole grain pasta. They tasted "okay," and the texture wasn't dramatically different. Unfortunately, I can't stand the smell of the noodles during the boiling process, so I ended up tossing the other boxes in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hackett

customer_reviews.title: size of box
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this at Costco and the box was much bigger with 4 pkg. inside, It never occurred to me to check the size of the box. The product is wonderful, it cooks perfectly and tasted wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noodle are good.
customer_reviews.text: These noodles are good. It doesn’t take as long to cook as regular flour noodles. Beware keto dieters these noodles still contain a lot of carbs. But super if you need gluten free.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great substitute for grain-based pasta. Higher in protein
customer_reviews.text: Taste slightly different than wheat-based pasta, however, the taste is still very good. Very good alternative to grain-based pasta. Easy to cook and has the same consistency as regular penna. Much higher in protein
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: Need to get used to eating this type of "pasta"
customer_reviews.text: If I didn't know that it was chickpeas I would have thought that it was overcooked pasta. It was fine, but I probably will not purchase again. No amount of sauce can cover the blah taste. I have 4 more boxes, so I will get through them. I wanted to like them, but I just couldn't.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: It Is Not Your "Regular" Pasta
customer_reviews.text: I had heard about chick pea pasta and wanted to increase my protein intake, so I decided to try it. Although it is somewhat different than "regular" pasta, I think it is a good substitute. It is a little more chewy and has more than the bland taste. It worked well with the pesto and chicken pasta dish I have made with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Vann

customer_reviews.title: Yum!
customer_reviews.text: I personally didn't taste a difference between these and regular pasta. I liked this brand MUCH better than other brands for chickpea pasta. Will be purchasing this pasta again and again.
customer_reviews.author: emkay

customer_reviews.title: Taste great, gluten free and NON-GMO
customer_reviews.text: If you have gluten problems or Celiac Disease, this is a great product. I love pasta, but finally quit eating it, because the discomfort was not worth it. This product is amazing. It tastes great, cooks easily and goes with any sauce out there. I came across this product on Amazon by accident and it literally changed my life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like pasta, but with protein!
customer_reviews.text: My husband couldn't tell the difference when we made dinner. Plus, these hold up better during reheating.
customer_reviews.author: Reader in the Boro

customer_reviews.title: Delicious, filling, guilt-free
customer_reviews.text: I love Banza! I don't think I'll buy regular pasta for a long time. Unlike other "healthy" pasta substitutes, Banza tastes great, the texture is similar to regular pasta, and it pairs as well with all of my favorite sauces and pasta preparations. The best part is how high-protein it is.. I truly do not get hungry for hours after eating, without feeling sluggish or slow. I've tried most of the shapes at this point - the penne is tried and true, and I also really like the shells and angel hair. Great choice for anyone looking to make small healthy changes, eat more protein, or who just want a filling and yummy pasta option!
customer_reviews.author: dahl

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor, healthy alternative
customer_reviews.text: Surprised how good this pasta is. Been trying to cut back on my carbs and found this product. I made the penne the other night and my teenager really liked it as well as myself. Definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Delicious - Family Favorite!
customer_reviews.text: Cooks up beautifully, not mushy. Firm and delicious with lots of protein and less carbs! We love it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff! If you cook it properly, boil for just 6 minutes for a whole box, it tastes delicious. I did a taste test with the family and they all liked it. Of course it’s not just like “normal” pasta, but definitely satisfies my need for pasta every one in a while.
customer_reviews.author: DMcGrath

customer_reviews.title: Good gluten-free, high nutrition pasta.
customer_reviews.text: Why doesn't everyone switch over to bean pasta? Say No to gluten and switch to Banza which is high in protein and other valuable nutrients. Cooks well till Al dente. If overcooked, disintegrates like any other pasta would. Needs watching but I don't mind and as long as I add a teaspoon of oil, doesn't clump.
customer_reviews.author: Smitha

customer_reviews.title: Yum. I can handle this.
customer_reviews.text: I am unlucky enough to be allergic to wheat so I get to enjoy pasta alternatives. This one is super high on my list. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

product_meta.title: Banza Chickpea Pasta, Variety Pack (2 Penne/2 Rotini/2 Shells) - Gluten Free Healthy Pasta, High Protein, Lower Carb and Non-GMO - (Pack of 6)
product_meta.description: Flavor:Penne, Rotini, ShellsAt Banza, we believe that food can be as nutritious as it is delicious. That's why we're making chickpea-powered versions of all our favorites. With a whopping 23G of plant-based protein in every serving and 30% fewer net carbs than traditional pasta, now you can make every night a pasta night. Spaghetti & meatballs? Vegan mac & cheese? Fabulous fried rice? Banza is here for you, no matter what is on the menu. Our 17 shapes of pasta, five types of mac & cheese, and two versions of rice give you the perfect canvas to create a culinary masterpiece.
feature_bullets: Banza chickpea pasta is a high protein, lower carb, gluten free alternative to traditional pasta. Each serving has 2x the protein, 3x the fiber, and 1/2 the net carbs of traditional pasta. Try substituting Banza for an easy and healthy family meal.

Picky eaters? No problem! Banza chickpea pasta tastes, looks and cooks more like traditional pasta than other alternative pastas, including lentil pasta, quinoa pasta, black bean pasta, edamame pasta, brown rice pasta, and whole wheat pasta.

Chickpeas make delicious pasta and are great for an easy vegetarian or vegan meal. Banza chickpea pasta is also low glycemic and high fiber. If you’re searching for an easy family meal, Banza’s non-GMO chickpea pasta is the pasta for you!

A favorite among Kristen Bell and Robin Roberts, Banza has been featured in TIME Magazine’s 25 Best Inventions of 2015, the New York Times, Food & Wine Magazine, the Today Show, Huffington Post, Good Morning America, and Generation Startup.

You can’t miss Banza’s bright orange box! Find our chickpea pasta at retailers like Whole Foods, Target, Sprouts, and Kroger. Banza comes in a variety of fun shapes like Rotini, Penne, Spaghetti, Linguine, Shells, Angel Hair, Rigatoni, and Ziti.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
